channel.title: Austin Delamar
channel.description: This is my blog about computers, programming, tech, and things that bother me. I hope it bothers you too.
channel.author: amdelamar

item.title: Exciting Trends in Web Technology
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: Offline-first, SPA, PWA, Docker, Blockchain, and more! There are lots of trends growing right now that its getting hard to keep up.

item.title: At the Office, Don't Assume Everything
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: Lot of workplace problems can be avoided by not assuming things. Communication is vital and when you assume something, it means you're not talking.

item.title: HTTPS Required
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: Websites should default to HTTPS now. Its safe to assume everyone should be using it already or planning to implement it.

item.title: Don't Violate Imgur's Terms of Service by using it as a CDN
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: I was using Imgur as a CDN (content delivery network) to host all my images for my websites. Don't make the same mistake I did!

item.title: Mini PCs Will Replace Desktops
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: SFF (small form factor) PCs will takeover the midtower PC market, just like how tablets have taken a chunk of the laptop share.

item.title: Some of My Favorite iOS Apps
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: Right now these apps are awesome: Signal, Firefox Focus, bitwarden, Authenticator, OpenVPN, and of course ProtonMail.

item.title: JavaScript Dependent Websites
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: If websites are like cake, then JavaScript would be the candles. But a cake without candles is still a cake. Right?

item.title: 2 Years Without Gmail
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: I switched to ProtonMail for better email privacy. I'm satisfied with my choice but its not without some drawbacks.

item.title: Video Game Trends that are Toxic
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: What's worse? Microtransactions, pre-order bonuses, yearly subscriptions, P2P networking, day-1 DLC, or something else?

item.title: Every Company needs a Web Developer
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: You'll also need lots of coffee to pay the developer.
